alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Comal; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Llano; Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Medina, central Bandera, southeastern Kerr, Blanco, eastern Gillespie, southern Llano, Kendall, southwestern Burnet, northwestern Bexar and northwestern Comal Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 422 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Enchanted Rock State Natural Area to Blumenthal to near Old Tunnel State Park to near Comfort to near Medina. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Medina, Boerne, Fredericksburg, Kingsland, Comfort, Blanco, Bandera, Round Mountain, Canyon Lake, Fair Oaks Ranch, Granite Shoals, Bulverde, Horseshoe Bay, Johnson City, Stonewall, Highland Haven, Guadalupe River State Park, Kendalia, Bandera Falls, and Rocky Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bandera; Bexar; Blanco; Burnet; Comal; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Llano; Medina
